drinks.name: Suissesse Cocktail

drinks.name: Society Cocktail
drinks.description: Stir with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

drinks.name: Citronella Cooler
drinks.description: Stir in Collins glass. Add ice and stir again. Squeeze and add lime.

drinks.name: Black Magic
drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into ice-filled old-fashioned glass. Add lemon twist.

drinks.name: A Night In Old Mandalay

drinks.name: Froupe Cocktail
drinks.description: Stir with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

drinks.name: Long Island Iced Tea
drinks.description: Mix all contents in a highball glass and sitr gently. Add dash of Coca-Cola for the coloring and garnish with lemon or lime twist.

drinks.name: Bermuda Rose

drinks.name: La Vita Dulce
drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Top with cinnamon.

drinks.name: Spiced Peach Punch
drinks.description: Combine peach nectar, orange juice and brown sugar in a large saucepan. Tie cinnamon and cloves in a small cheesecloth bag. Drop into saucepan. Heat slowly, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves. Simmer 10 minutes. Stir in lime juice. Serve in hot mugs.

drinks.name: Gloom Lifter
drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into highball glass with ice cubes.

drinks.name: Aztec Punch
drinks.description: Mix all ingredients in a pitcher. Mix thoroughly and pour into whatever is available, the bigger the better! This drink packs a big punch, so don't over do it.

drinks.name: Pink Paradise
drinks.description: Stir ingredients in ice-filled hurricane glass. Garnish with pineapple and cherry.

drinks.name: 19th Century
drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

drinks.name: Coffee-Vodka
drinks.description: Boil water and sugar until dissolved. Turn off heat. Slowly add dry instant coffee and continue stirring. Add a chopped vanilla bean to the vodka, then combine the cooled sugar syrup and coffee solution with the vodka. Cover tightly and shake vigorously each day for 3 weeks. Strain and filter. Its also best to let the sugar mixture cool completely so the vodka won't evaporate when its added. If you like a smoother feel to the liqueur you can add about 1 teaspoon of glycerine to the finished product.

ingredients: For glass For glass Lemon wedge, coarse salt
drinks.name: Rouxby Red
drinks.description: Rim chilled cocktail glass with lemon and salt. Shake remaining ingredients with ice and strain into glass.

drinks.name: Nutty Irishman
drinks.description: Serve over ice

drinks.name: Jade
drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with lime.

drinks.name: Barracuda
drinks.description: Shake pour ingredients with ice. Strain into glass, top with Sparkling wine.

drinks.name: B-52
drinks.description: Layer ingredients into a shot glass. Serve with a stirrer.

drinks.name: Paris When It Sizzles
drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with lime.

drinks.name: Millionaire Cocktail
drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

drinks.name: Arctic Fish
drinks.description: Fill glass with ice and fish, add vodka, grape soda and orange juice. DO NOT STIR!!!!! Serve well chilled.

drinks.name: X.Y.Z. Cocktail
drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

drinks.name: Froth Blower Cocktail
drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

drinks.name: Flaming Lamborghini
drinks.description: Pour the Sambuca and Kahlua into the Cocktail Glass and give the drinker a straw. Pour the Baileys and Blue Curacao into two sepsrate shot glasses either side of the cocktail glass. Set light the concotion in the cocktail glass and start to drink through the straw (this drink should be drunk in one) , as the bottom of the glass is reached put out the fire by pouring the Baileys and Blue Curacao into the cocktail glass and keep drinking till it's all gone!!

ingredients: 4 oz chopped bittersweet or semi-sweet  Chocolate
drinks.name: Orange Scented Hot Chocolate
drinks.description: Combine all ingredients in heavy medium saucepan. Stir over low heat until chocolate melts. Increase heat and bring just to a boil, stirring often. Remove from heat and whisk untily frothy. Return to heat and bring to boil again. Remove from heat, whisk until frothy. Repeat heating and whisking once again. Discard orange peel. (Can be prepared 2 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature. Before serving, bring just to boil, remove from heat and whisk until frothy.) Pour hot chocolate into coffee mugs. Makes 2 servings.

ingredients: 2 oz  Hot Shot Tropical Fruit Liqueur

drinks.name: Lassi - Sweet

drinks.name: Los Angeles Cocktail

drinks.name: Oh, Gosh!

ingredients: 1/2 oz  Old Mr. Boston Triple Sec

drinks.name: Quick F**K

drinks.name: Cablegram

drinks.name: Quentin
drinks.description: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, Kahlua, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the nutmeg.

drinks.name: Water Lily

drinks.name: Bulldog Highball

drinks.name: Egg Nog #4
drinks.description: In a small mixer bowl beat egg yolks till blended. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, beating at high speed till thick and lemon colored. Stir in milk, stir in rum, bourbon, vanilla, and salt. Chill thoroughly. Whip cream. Wash beaters well. In a large mixer bowl beat egg whites till soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar, beating to stiff peaks. Fold yolk mixture and whipped cream into egg whites. Serve immediately. Sprinkle nutmeg over each serving. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl. NOTE: For a nonalcoholic eggnog, prepare Eggnog as above, except omit the bourbon and rum and increase the milk to 3 cups.

drinks.name: Lassi Raita
drinks.description: Blend the yoghurt and ice cubes together, until the yoghurt becomes more liquid. Add sugar to taste. The lemon/lime is optional but it gives it a slightly tart taste. Dash of salt. Raita is also good for the summer. Instead of having a traditional salad you can make raita instead.

drinks.name: Catalina Margarita
drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

drinks.name: Sloe Tequila

drinks.name: Tommy's Margarita
drinks.description: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

ingredients: 1 oz  Old Mr. Boston Five Star Brandy

drinks.name: Thai Coffee
drinks.description: Place the coffee and spices in the filter cone of your coffee maker. Brew coffee as usual, let it cool. In a tall glass, dissolve 1 or 2 teaspoons of sugar in an ounce of the coffee (it's easier to dissolve than if you put it right over ice). Add 5-6 ice cubes and pour coffee to within about 1 inch of the top of the glass. Rest a spoon on top of the coffee and slowly pour whipping cream into the spoon. This will make the cream float on top of the coffee rather than dispersing into it right away.

drinks.name: Herbal flame

drinks.name: Yoghurt Cooler

Note: Use lots of ice in this one - great on hot days! To add ice: Remove the center of the cover while the blender is on - drop 3 or 4 ice cubs and blend until they're completely crushed.

drinks.name: Coffee Liqueur
drinks.description: Combine coffee, sugar and water. Simmer 1 hour and let cool. Add vanilla and vodka. Age in sealed jar 2 to 3 weeks.

drinks.name: L'italienne

drinks.name: Alexander Cocktail No. 1

Repeat this process for the Sambuca. If done properly, the alcohol will stay separated and resemble a bumble bee. Enjoy!!!

ingredients: 2 oz  Mr. Boston Creme de menthe
drinks.name: Zero Mint

drinks.name: Allegheny

Stir while the coffee brews, this is the fun part. The cocoa seems to coat the honey without mixing, so you get a dusty, sticky mass that looks as though it will never mix. Then all at once, presto! It looks like dark chocolate sauce. Pour hot espresso over the honey, stirring to dissolve. Serve with cream.

drinks.name: Castillian Hot Chocolate

Begin heating the mixture, stirring it with a whisk, and gradually pour in the milk. Continue stirring with the whisk as you bring the liquid to a simmer. Allow the chocolate to simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring often, until it is thick, glossy and completely smooth. Serve steaming hot in coffee mug. Serves six.

drinks.name: Frappé
drinks.description: Mix together. Blend at highest blender speed for about 1 minute. Pour into a glass and drink with a straw. Notes: This works best if everything is cold (if you make fresh coffee, mix it with the milk and let it sit in the fridge for 1/2 hour. If it is not frothy, add more milk, or even just some more milk powder. The froth gradually turns to liquid at the bottom of the glass, so you will find that you can sit and drink this for about 1/2 hour, with more iced coffee continually appearing at the bottom. Very refreshing.

Done correctly, the Schnapps will flow under the Kahlua for a clear layer. 3. Again using a spoon, but this time right side up, slowly top off the glass with a layer of Bailey's. Be careful to place the spoon right at the top of the Kahlua layer and to raise it as the glass fills up. Done correctly, this will provide a layer of Bailey's floating over the Kahlua. 4. Toss it down all at once for something like a Peppermint Pattie, WITH A BANG!!! NOTE: Best if all ingredients are chilled

drinks.description: Pour the wine into a kettle. Insert cheesecloth bag containing remaining ingredients and boil slowly for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add 1 lb. each blanched almonds and seedless raisins and continue to boil for additional 15 minutes. Remove kettle from stove and place wire grill containing 1 lb. lump sugar over opening. Pour one 750-ml Brandy over sugar, making sure to saturate all of it. Then light sugar with match and let it flame. After sugar has melted, replace kettle cover to extinguish flame. drinks.name: Vampiro
drinks.description: Vampiros may be made in a tall glass or an old fashioned glass. Bartenders may first "rim" the glass with Kosher Salt, which is done by placing a layer of Kosher Salt on a chopping board, moistening the glass' rim with lime juice or water, and then placing the upside down glass rim onto the Kosher Salt, so that the salt sticks to the moistened rim. The second step is to fill half the glass with ice and add one or two shooter glasses full of high quality Tequila. The next stage is to add the flavouring elements. This is done by squeezing a fresh lime into the glass, adding a few grains of salt, adding citrus-flavoured soda pop, until the glass is 4/5 full, and then adding spicy Viuda de Sanchez (or orange juice, lime juice and pico de gallo). The final step is to stir the ingredients so that the flavours are properly blended.

drinks.name: Amaretto Liqueur
drinks.description: Combine sugar and 3/4 cup water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer until all sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and cool. In an aging container, combine apricot halves, almond extract, grain alcohol with 1/2 cup water, and brandy. Stir in cooled sugar syrup mixture. Cap and let age for 2 days. Remove apricot halves. (Save apricot halves, can be used for cooking). Add food coloring and glycerine. Stir, recap and continue aging for 1 to 2 months. Re-bottle as desired. Liqueur is ready to serve but will continue to improve with additional aging.

ingredients: 1/2 oz  each Orange juice and simple syrup

ingredients: 1 oz  Peeled and chopped fresh ginger

drinks.name: The Vacation Cocktail

Close the shaker and shake vigorously. Pour the liquid into a glass, top up with ginger ale, stir with a teaspoon and then garnish the rim of the glass with a slice of lime

drinks.name: Champagne Velvet

drinks.name: The Duboudreau Cocktail

drinks.name: Gin and It

drinks.name: Mexicana
drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

drinks.name: Floridita No. 1

drinks.name: Jamaica Hop

drinks.name: Fancy Whiskey

drinks.description: Mix lemonade and water according to instructions on back of can. If the instructions say to add 4 1/3 cans of water do so. Mix into pitcher. Add 1 1/2 cup of Vodka (Absolut). Mix well. Pour into glass of crushed ice. Excellent!

drinks.name: S & V
drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with lime.

drinks.name: Three Stripes Cocktail

drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

drinks.description: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

If you do it right, you should be able to see that the two liquids are separated, with the vodka on top. Now slam it! The last thing you'll taste is the kool-aid.

drinks.name: Egg-Nog - Classic Cooked
drinks.description: In large saucepan, beat together eggs, sugar and salt, if desired. Stir in 2 cups of the milk. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick enough to coat a metal spoon and reaches 160 degrees F. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 2 cups milk and vanilla. Cover and regfigerate until thoroughly chilled, several hours or overnight. Just before serving, pour into bowl or pitcher. Garnish or add stir-ins, if desired. Choose 1 or several of: Chocolate curls, cinnamon sticks, extracts of flavorings, flavored brandy or liqueur, fruit juice or nectar, ground nutmeg, maraschino cherries, orange slices, peppermint sticks or candy canes, plain brandy, run or whiskey, sherbet or ice-cream, whipping cream, whipped. Serve immediately.

drinks.name: Vodka Russian
drinks.description: Mix it as a ordinary drink .

drinks.name: Will Rogers

Stir slightly and garnish with a spiralled cucumber skin and a red cherry. The cucumber provides zest and looks attractive. This drink, created by Timo Haimi, took first prize in the 1991 Finlandia Vodka Long Drink Competition.
